title: The 2025 Patriots season was a success. You can still feel sick about its ending.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots lost to the Seattle Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX, falling short of a championship.
Despite the loss, the Patriots exceeded expectations with a young roster, finishing the season with a strong playoff presence.
Quarterback Drake Maye and Coach Mike Vrabel aim to build on this year's success for future seasons, with significant cap space available.

title: Drake Maye admits he needed pain-killing shot for shoulder injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye received a pain-killing injection for his right shoulder before Super Bowl LX.
Maye completed 27-of-43 passes for 295 yards with two touchdowns in Patriots' 29-13 loss to Seahawks.
The shoulder injury occurred during the AFC Championship, but Maye participated in all practices before the Super Bowl.

title: What Mike Vrabel had to say about the Patriots after Super Bowl LX loss
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel spoke on the Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks, emphasizing teamwork over individual blame.
Vrabel defended quarterback Drake Maye, stating the defeat wasn't solely his responsibility and highlighting the need for better team execution.
Despite the loss, Vrabel praised the Seahawks, emphasizing the need for the Patriots to learn and improve for future successes.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in Super Bowl loss to Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez and Craig Woodson excelled in Super Bowl LX amid team's 29-13 loss to the Seahawks.
New England's offensive line faltered, allowing six sacks and stifling the run, contributing to Patriots' struggles.
Seattle's Kenneth Walker III earned MVP honors by exploiting Patriots' defense for significant gains.

title: What an emotional Drake Maye said of Super Bowl LX loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye and the New England Patriots lost Super Bowl LX to the Seattle Seahawks, 29-13.
Maye described his performance, noting several turnovers including two interceptions and a strip-sack.
Despite the loss, Maye expressed optimism about the future, highlighting team relationships and plans for improvement.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Bad Bunny delivered a joyful, Latin-culture themed halftime show at Super Bowl 60, featuring Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin.
The performance, held at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, featured a medley of hits and emphasized unity and love.
Despite criticism from some conservatives, the show included diverse celebratory elements like a real wedding and salsa performances.

title: Super Bowl celebrities: Here’s who was spotted in Santa Clara
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Celebrities at Super Bowl LX included Jay-Z, Blue Ivy, Tom Brady, Peyton Manning, and Lady Gaga at Levi's Stadium.
Halftime performances featured Bad Bunny with guests Cardi B and Karol G; Green Day also performed with Billie Joe Armstrong.
Other notable attendees included Ricky Martin, Justin Bieber, Hailey Bieber, Roger Federer, and Robert Downey Jr.

title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts State Police warn of a fake Instagram account impersonating a female trooper with more than 100,000 followers.
The fake account uses AI-generated content and links to adult content on a free OnlyFans page.
A similar account impersonates a Santa Monica officer, both reported to social media platforms for removal.

title: In Patriots territory, Seahawks fans find a home base for the Super Bowl
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Alma Cantina and White Bull Tavern hosted a Seattle Seahawks watch party in Patriots territory on Super Bowl Sunday.
Alma Cantina welcomed over 100 Seahawks fans, filling to capacity with help from the Boston Seahawks Fan Facebook group.
The event provided Seahawks fans with a community atmosphere amid a predominantly Patriots-supporting area in Boston.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs shoved to the ground as punches fly during sideline scuffle
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Stefon Diggs and Seattle's Josh Jobe involved in a sideline altercation without penalties or ejections.
Patriots lacked offensive protection and struggled to get open, with Stefon Diggs recording one catch for five yards.
Stefon Diggs, 32, facing assault charges, scheduled for arraignment on Feb. 13; denies allegations with team's support.
